news_header: Post-LA wildfires, homes may release toxic chemicals for months, posing health risks.
news_original_title: Toxic dangers lurk in LA, even in homes that didn’t burn
news_text: After the LA wildfires, homes that survived may still emit dangerous chemicals from burnt materials, affecting air and water quality. Experts warn that toxic residues can linger for months, potentially harming residents' health. The aftermath of wildfires often leads to the release of heavy metals and volatile organic compounds (VOCs) into the environment. Safety precautions are necessary for those returning to affected areas, including wearing protective gear and testing water and soil for contaminants. Cleaning homes thoroughly is essential to mitigate health risks from lingering smoke and ash.
